Post-Graduate Diploma in Hospitality & Tourism

COURSE DURATION:

  • 1 Year

 

ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS:

  • You must have successfully completed the CTH Graduate Diploma in Hospitality and Tourism Management, or have been granted an exemption from this.
  • Minimum of a degree graded ‘third’ or above.
  • Minimum Three Years Work Experience at supervisory or management level for non-graduates from the Tourism and Hospitality Industries.
  • You must be able to read, write and speak English

 

COURSE STRUCTURE:

  • You will be assessed via investigative assignments, presentations and action research activities.
  • You’ll need to demonstrate interpersonal, self-study, research and presentation skills.
  • You will be assessed at one of our Academies, and in turn the CTH will conduct external marking and moderation of assessments to ensure standards are being met.

 

COURSE CONTENT: 

  • Module One: Hospitality & Tourism Marketing Strategies
  • Module Two: Management and Leadership Across Cultures
  • Module Three: Hospitality & Tourism Strategic Planning

Choose ONE of the Following:

  • Managing Hospitality & Tourism Projects
  • Research Methods for Hospitality and Tourism Managers

 

CAREER PATH:

  • Secure employment at senior supervisory/Management level as a:
    • General Manager
    • Club Manager
    • Group Tour Operations Manager
    • Hotel Manager
    • Tourism Board Manager
    • Training Manager
    • Group Restaurant Manager
    • Group Travel Agency Manager

 

PROGRESS OPPORTUNITIES:

  • Convert your Post-Graduate Diploma to a Masters Degree at a range of universities in the UK:

 

OTHER MANAGEMENT PROGRAMMES IN HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM.

  • Certificate in Hospitality & Tourism
  • Diploma in Hospitality & Tourism
  • Advanced Diploma in Hospitality & Tourism
  • Pro-Graduate Diploma in Hospitality & Tourism
  • Post-Graduate Diploma in Hospitality & Tourism
